section.title: Target of this exercise
section.para: In this exercise you define another perspective and implement a menu to switch between your perspectives.

section.title: Create a new perspective
section.para: Define a new perspective called Manager in your application. You should know by now how to do this, therefore it is not described in this exercise. Ensure that your new perspective has at least one part in it (contained in a PartStack so that the part label is visible).

warning.para: Ensure to add the perspective to the existing PerspectiveStack.

section.title: Create new menu entries
section.para: Create a command and a handler to switch between perspectives. The handler class for switching perspectives might look like the following.
Create or update a Windows menu entry in your menu main with a sub-menu called Switch Perspective .
Add a new menu entry in your application model to switch between your perspectives.
Test if you can switch between your perspectives with your new handler.

section.title: Using command parameters to define the perspective ID
section.para:
Currently your perspective switcher only allows to switch between two perspectives. Use parameters in your command and menu entries to specify to which perspective you want to switch. See
for an example how to do this.
